intro: Rhododendron aucubifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf rhododendron, is a species native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its large, leathery leaves that are typically oval or elliptic in shape. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
